title: Ticket #1026: Purge dprintf debug levels already on life support
description:
Removed levels should be assigned the next D_UNUSED# entry so it's clear they shouldn't be used.

D_KEYBOARD is used one in ResAttributes.cpp:571, CpuAttributes::display. Is that really useful? Proposed: delete the attribute, probably replace with D_FULLDEBUG?

D_PREEMPT appears to be completely unused.

D_NFS is solely used in condor_syscall_lib/extern_path.c. Is it really important enough to keep? Can it be D_FULLDEBUG?
remarks:
2010-Feb-01 10:37:25 by psilord:
D_KEYBOARD is useful because you'll get a ton of lines in the log every 5 seconds and eventually the whole log will be filled with that. It turns the log useless.
2010-Oct-20 16:03:30 by jfrey:
Bulk change of target version from v070504 to v070505 using ./ticket-target-mover.

2010-Dec-21 14:24:40 by matt:
Zapped D_PREEMPT, keeping D_KEYBOARD on Pete's advice, leaving D_NFS for now. Another ticket should be opened for D_NFS is the desire to remove it still exists.
check_ins: 2010-Dec-21 14:23   Check-in [19759]: Removed D_PREEMPT, now D_UNUSED3, #1026 (By Matthew Farrellee )
creator: adesmet
